alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 14 at 10:35PM CDT until August 15 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Alabama and northwest Alabama, including the following counties, in north central Alabama, Limestone and Morgan. In northwest Alabama, Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1035 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Decatur, Hartselle, Moulton, Priceville, Trinity, Mooresville, Caddo, Neel, Basham, Chalybeate Springs, Wren, Bankhead National Forest and Landersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
